title: Microsoft Corp. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
text:
Shares of Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       rose 1.56% to $420.55 Friday, on what proved to be an all-around mixed trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        +0.11%
       rising 0.57% to 5,026.61 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       falling 0.14% to 38,671.69. This was the stock's third consecutive day of gains. Microsoft Corp. hit a new 52-week high, surpassing its previous peak of $415.56, which the company achieved on February 8th. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Friday, as Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       rose 0.41% to $188.85, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 2.04% to $150.22, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 2.12% to $149.00. Trading volume (21.7 M) remained 3.8 million below its 50-day average volume of 25.5 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. The stock looks like a bet on Trump himself more than a company with significant revenue and profits.
